website_content.content:
This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten,

'The Big Weekend Show' panelists sound off on the Biden administration and border crisis.
The left-leaning fact check site Snopes reversed one of its rulings this weekend to admit that President Biden did, in fact, wear a construction hard hat backwards.
Biden was pictured during a visit to union workers in Wisconsin alongside Sen. Amy Klobuchar, D-Minn. The photo clearly shows Biden wearing the hard hat backwards, with the strap and tightening knob clearly visible.
Snopes' initial fact check, published Friday, attempted to explain the appearance.
"The photo is genuine. And it does look, at first glance, like Biden was wearing that hard hat backwards. But after comparing it to other photos and videos of the same event, we were forced to reach the opposite conclusion: The hat on Biden's head was facing forward, bill to the front, not backward," Snopes claimed.
DOZENS OF SENATE REPUBLICANS WARN BIDEN'S LATEST WAR ON ENERGY EMPOWERS AMERICA'S ENEMIES
The left-leaning political fact checker Snopes reversed one of its rulings this weekend to admit that President Biden did, in fact, wear a construction hard hat backwards. (Twitter @amyklobuchar)
Social media users blasted the determination, however, as hard hats universally have the tightening strap on the back. After weathering a storm on social media, Snopes offered an update reversing the fact check.
"The prevailing counter-argument is that if the suspension of the hat has been purposely configured by its owner such that the bill and tightening knob are worn to the back (as was the case of the hat Biden wore), to wear that hat with the bill facing forward is, practically speaking, to wear...[Content truncated]

website_quality_evaluation.justification: Fox News is a well-established news outlet, but it has a reputation for having a conservative bias. While it provides news coverage, the network has been criticized for sensationalism and presenting news in a politically charged manner. It can also occasionally promote partisan viewpoints, which might not always represent the full truth.

Relevance.Relevance Justification: This article from Fox News clearly states that Snopes initially rated Biden's hard hat incident incorrectly before reversing their conclusion to confirm he wore it backwards. It provides specific details and shows how the narrative changed, confirming the claim's accuracy.

Did Biden Wear a Hard Hat Backwards in Photo Op with Construction Workers?
==========================================================================
, 
Posted on AllSides January 31st, 2024
From The Left
FACT CHECK
U.S. President Joe Biden wore a hard hat backwards during a photo op with union construction workers in Superior, Wisconsin.
Rating: True
Editor's Note: We received a ton of comments in a very short time challenging our assumption that wearing a hard hat "backwards" means wearing it with the bill facing to the rear, and "forwards" means wearing it bill to the front. On the basis of that assumption, we originally rated the claim that Biden was wearing a hard hat backwards as false.
, 
-----------------------------------------------------
]
AllSides Media Bias Rating: 
*   
*   
128592/95803

It provides affirmation of the claim's validity and adds context that is relevant to understanding how the claim was initially mischaracterized.

metatags.twitter:title: Snopes Fact-Check Calls True Biden Story ‘False’ Despite Photos THEY Included in Post — Then Reverses It
metatags.og:title: Snopes Fact-Check Calls True Biden Story ‘False’ Despite Photos THEY Included in Post — Then Reverses It
metatags.og:description: A photo that shows President Joe Biden wearing a hard hat backwards was labeled "false" by Snopes before they changed their minds after pushback.
metatags.twitter:creator: @calebhowe
metatags.twitter:description: A photo that shows President Joe Biden wearing a hard hat backwards was labeled "false" by Snopes before they changed their minds after pushback.

website_content.content:
[Content truncated]...4

There were many other reactions.
Here are the photos @snopes literally uses in their factcheck where they judge “Biden wore the hardhat backwards” as False: https://t.co/KcGGFbN9FU pic.twitter.com/mQT65LghE5
— NeverTweet (@LOLNeverTweet) January 27, 2024

Eventually, Snopes responded to the feedback by reversing their ruling on the photos of Biden wearing a hard backwards to True.

The updated article contained an editor’s note, explaining the complete 180.
Editor’s Note: We received a ton of comments in a very short time challenging our assumption that wearing a hard hat “backwards” means wearing it with the brim facing to the rear, and “forwards” means wearing it brim to the front. On the basis of that assumption, we originally rated the claim that Biden was wearing a hard hat backwards as false.
The prevailing counter-argument is that if the suspension of the hat has been purposely configured by its owner such that the bill and tightening knob are worn to the back (as was the case of the hat Biden wore), to wear that hat with the bill facing forward is, practically speaking, to wear it backwards. Therefore, it’s argued, it’s actually true that, in the photo op discussed below, Biden was wearing it backwards. The strap and tightening knob, which should have been behind Biden’s head, were on his forehead.
A corollary to that argument is “Biden looks damn silly in any case.”
We find these arguments sound. Therefore, the claim “President Joe Biden wore a hard hat backwards during a photo op with union construction workers in Superior, Wisconsin” is true, and this fact check has been re-rated as such. Thanks to all who argued on behalf of this correction.
So ultimately, the fact-checkers ruled that the obviously backward hat was backward after all, and that the photo of Biden wearing a hard hat backwards was indeed a photo of Biden wearing a hard hat backwards. But only after some convincing.
Have a tip we should know? tips@mediaite.com
Caleb Howe is an editor and writer focusing on politics and media. Former managing editor at RedState. Published at USA Today, Blaze, National Review, Daily Wire, American Spectator, AOL News, Asylum, fortune cookies, manifestos, napkins, fridge drawings...

Have a tip or story idea? Email us.
 Or to keep it anonymous, click here.

website_quality_evaluation.justification: Mediaite focuses on the intersection of media and politics and provides insightful commentary and reporting on news coverage. While generally reliable, it can feature editorialized content that may lean towards a particular viewpoint.

Relevance.Relevance Justification: This evidence details how Snopes reversed its initial rating about Biden's hat, highlighting the backlash and explaining how the claim was ultimately validated. It directly addresses whether Biden wore the hat backwards, making it highly relevant.

Snopes Fact-Checker Claims Biden Didn't Wear Hard Hat Backwards (He Did)
========================================================================
January 27th, 2024 3:33 PM
Text to Speech
00:00 00:00
Font Size
&body=SnopesFact-CheckerClaimsBidenDidn'tWearHardHatBackwards\(HeDid\)%0D%0DReadMore:https://www.newsbusters.org/blogs/nb/alex-christy/2024/01/27/snopes-fact-checker-claims-biden-didnt-wear-hard-hat-backwards-he "Printer Friendly, PDF & Email"))
_UPDATE: In response to criticism, Snopes  their "false" rating to "true" on Saturday._
_\*\*\*_
David Emery, one of the fact-checking sleuths at , defended President Joe Biden on Friday against accusations that he wore a hard hat backwards during a recent photo op in Wisconsin. The only problem for Emery and Biden is that Biden did wear the hat backwards.
The photo in question comes from Sen. Amy Klobuchar:
> Nothing like having a beer with some great union workers and ⁦yes, that would be ⁩ in Superior, Wisconsin. ⁦⁩ 
> 
> — Amy Klobuchar (@amyklobuchar) 
After going through several tweets where people claim Biden is wearing the hat backwards, Emery writes, “The photo is genuine. And it does look, at first glance, like Biden was wearing that hard hat backwards. But after comparing it to other photos and videos of the same event, we were forced to reach the opposite conclusion: The hat on Biden's head was facing forward, bill to the front, not backward.”
Emery then shows several more tweets of photos of Biden interacting with a man who was wearing the hat he would eventually wear including the following one from CBS:
> President Biden to unveil nearly $5 billion in new infrastructure projects 
> 
> — CBS Evening News (@CBSEveningNews) 
Asking many rhetorical questions, Emery urges readers to “Look closely, though. Which direction is the bill of that hat facing? Is the construction worker wearing it forwards or backwards?”
A hard hat is not a...[Content truncated]

Fox News Digital reports Biden was pictured during a visit to union workers in Wisconsin alongside Sen. Amy Klobuchar, D-Minn. The photo clearly shows Biden wearing the hard hat backwards, with the strap and tightening knob clearly visible.
Snopes' initial fact check, published Friday, attempted to explain the appearance.


The left-leaning political fact checker Snopes reversed one of its rulings this weekend to admit that President Biden did, in fact, wear a construction hard hat backwards. (Twitter @amyklobuchar)
Social media users blasted the determination, however, as hard hats universally have the tightening strap on the back. After weathering a storm on social media, Snopes offered an update reversing the fact check.
"The prevailing counter-argument is that if the suspension of the hat has been purposely configured by its owner such that the bill and tightening knob are worn to the back (as was the case of the hat Biden wore), to wear that hat with the bill facing forward is, practically speaking, to wear it backwards. Therefore, it's argued, it's actually true that, in the photo op discussed below, Biden was wearing it backwards. The strap and tightening knob, which should have been behind Biden's head, were on his forehead."

website_quality_evaluation.justification: This site appears to be a blog that may cover media commentary. Blogs typically vary greatly in reliability, often lacking rigorous editorial standards, leading to potential misinformation.

Relevance.Relevance Justification: This source also confirms that Biden indeed wore the hard hat backwards, similar to evidence1 and evidence4. It addresses the backlash on Snopes' initial ruling and ultimately supports the claim with further clarification.
